meanings.sent1: The refusers stood their ground and did not give in.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked for volunteers, but the refusers stayed silent.
meanings.sent3: The refusers at the party refused to dance, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The refusers were like stubborn rocks, unmoved by any persuasion.
meanings.sent5: The refusers were like a wall, blocking any attempts to change their minds.

meanings.definition: Those who decline to accept or comply with something.
meanings.sent1: The refusers of the new policy voiced their concerns at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The refusers of the invitation missed out on a fun event.
meanings.sent3: The refusers of the group project ended up regretting their decision.
meanings.sent4: The refusers were like closed doors, shutting out any compromise.
meanings.sent5: The refusers were like anchors, holding firm against the tide of change.
